Package FrontEnd.Portal

Class PortalController

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrontEnd.Portal.PortalController

  • public class PortalController
extends java.lang.Object
    1. First the user must select the route FROM - TO Time of leaving / Arrival time Number of passengers Program will search the database for matching trains and return them. There must be enough seats! Seat configuration and position dont matter when travelling together. 2. Second is the position selection Seat will have seatType. Types: Allergy(green), Pet(brown), disabled(orange), quiet(blue), family(red), taken(gray), economy(white) Whatever the type, user must be able to select the position to sit in. 3. Payment of commute User can pay in the application or in the train. After payment, program will declare seats taken. Upon seats declared taken, other clients will be notified. X. User settings tab will be activable at any time In this tab, user can delcare: Address information new password billing information TO BE NOTED: Trains in database travel every day at the same time, so datepicker is just a placeholder for future expanding of application.

        Pick the highlighted item (train) from the listview

      • loadGraphicalCabin

        private void loadGraphicalCabin​(int cabinIndex)
        This method loads the cabin to the gridpane and also sets the indicator (label) Seat numbering is from up to down, left to right as follows: 1 5 9 ... 2 6 10 ... 3 7 11 ... 4 8 12 ... and seat index = number - 1
        Parameters:
        cabinIndex - number of cabinet to present as index

      • initNewGridPane

        private void initNewGridPane​()
        Initialize a gridpane so its clickable. This is very important! PS. spent many days figuring this bug out

      • showPane

        private void showPane​(int i)
        Displays pane that is passed as parameter
        Parameters:
        i - index of pane

      • switchToPane1

        public void switchToPane1​()
        Switch to first pane and reset seat selector index

      • prevCabinButton

        public void prevCabinButton​()
        Button to control cabin selector. Updaes visual view

      • nextCabinButton

        public void nextCabinButton​()
        Button to control cabin selectior. Updates visual view

      • confirmSeatSelectionButton

        public void confirmSeatSelectionButton​()
        Confirms the selected seat if index is != -1 and changes pane to order pane

      • changeScrollDirection

        public void changeScrollDirection​(javafx.scene.input.ScrollEvent scrollEvent)
        This is very cool. When scrolling vertically (e.g. desktop mouse) this method will translate it to actually scroll horizontally!
        Parameters:
        scrollEvent - scrollevent to be translated

      • getNodeByRowColumnIndex

        private javafx.scene.Node getNodeByRowColumnIndex​(int row,
                                                  int column,
                                                  javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
        This function simplifies life by getting a node in a gridpane since there is no native solution :)
        Parameters:
        row - row to be selected
        column - column to be selected
        gridPane - gridpane to run selection on
        Returns:
        return the node

      • payWithCreditCard

        public void payWithCreditCard​()
        Button to pay with credit card. You can add credit card functionality here or direct it to backend. Checks that fields are not empty

      • generateReservationNo

        private java.lang.String generateReservationNo​()
        Reservation number is generated by 4 last chars of train serialization string, cabin number and seat number.
        Returns:
        reservation number

      • reserveSeat

        public void reserveSeat​()
        Reserves seat and saves it to train database

      • payWithCreditCardRadioButton

        public void payWithCreditCardRadioButton​()
        Radio button group is defined in FXML file, here is only the functionality. Disables reserve button and enables pay with CC button.

      • payInTrainRadioButton

        public void payInTrainRadioButton​()
        Radio button group is defined in FXML file This only disables pay with CC button and enables reservation button.

      • switchToPane2

        public void switchToPane2​()
        Switches pane back to seat selection pane while reservation is not made. If reservation is already made this button should be disabled to avoid duplicate reservations

      • exitApplication

        public void exitApplication​()
        Exits the application (Button)

      • makeANewReservation

        public void makeANewReservation​()
        returns to firts pane and resets necessary variables. Also clears the result list since one train has a new serialization that needs to be fetched.

      • toggleHistoryPane

        public void toggleHistoryPane​()
        This is available on every screen. Here you can add functionality on how to display reservation history.

      • addSampleHistory

        private void addSampleHistory​()
        Adds a simple sample history to the historypane.
